I take the time every day to read and think about the posts in this group in the hopes that I 
can learn and someday help others that have the same questions that I do.  I feel part of the cost of 
membership of any group is to listen and participate even if it is to only read other people's questions and thoughts.
If you don't feel like helping me, that is your decision and I respect that.  What I would ask of you is to limit
the frivolous chatter in this group that seems to fill my inbox including your pompous lectures that imply that you are 
some kind of royalty so that replies that have useful content can get their due attention.

lee



12/27/01 12:54:47 PM, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbr@...> wrote:

>
>
>
>   You are not entitled to answers. No-one is entitled to answers. We do
>   not do your job for you. We help you, perhaps, out of the goodness of
>   our hearts, when we have time and when we know the answers. You may
>   perhaps allow for the possibility that we are on vacation and not
>   sitting by our internet connections, just waiting to answer every one of
>   your questions.
>
>   You are forthwith ignored.
>
>   Sorry for the tenor of the response, but I grow tired of people who
>   think they own my ass because I contribute to this list.
>
>   JBR.
>
>   lchalupa wrote:
>
>   > Would someone please take a look at a posting from me on the JUNIT
>   > group a two days ago.
>   > It concerns how to test a method that uses jOptionPane.  I got one
>   reply.
>   >
>   > In the meantime, what else got a response?  Well, we seem to have time
>   > to respond to trivial subjects and partake
>   > in what is nothing short of mental masturbation and ignore substantive
>   > questions that require some effort.
>   > I think I have read about 30 messages about getters and setters that
>   > sounds more like a pissing contest.  And then there is the chatter
>   > about one piece of spam.  How many worthless messages did this "spam"
>   > generate?  Boy we nailed that one didn't we?
>   >
>   > If you need someone to chat with, get a dog.  I got one, he just
>   > doesn't know java/junit...yet.
>   >
>   > Sorry for the vent but I grow tired of groping in the dark.
>   >
>   > Thanks for your help.
>   >
>   > Lee Chalupa
